definition: content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: Placebos work, doctors believed, because the mind is a powerful thing.
sentences.chinese: 医生们相信安慰剂起作用，是因为念力是一种力量。

sentences.english: The power of the placebo effect is illustrated in the movie classic, The Wizard Of Oz.
sentences.chinese: 经典电影《绿野仙踪》就是安慰剂效应的有力证明。

sentences.english: Placebos are often overlooked in medical studies.
sentences.chinese: 许多医学研究常常忽略安慰剂的作用。

sentences.english: Placebos are still a scientific mystery.
sentences.chinese: 安慰剂仍然是科学谜团。

sentences.english: Patients who receive dummy pills often show clinical improvement.
sentences.chinese: 服用安慰剂的患者常表现出临床症状明显改善。

sentences.english: You’ve probably heard of the placebo effect, especially in drug testing.
sentences.chinese: 你可能听说过安慰剂效应，尤其在药品测试期间。

sentences.english: “Placebo” is derived from a Latin word meaning “I shall please.
sentences.chinese: “安慰剂”一词来自于拉丁语，意为“使愉悦”。

sentences.english: Half of the participants drank a sterile milkshake as a placebo instead.
sentences.chinese: 一半的参与者喝无菌奶昔作为安慰剂。

sentences.english: The children were randomized to either etanercept or placebo.
sentences.chinese: 这些儿童被随机予依那西普或安慰剂组。

sentences.english: Two will take either a vitamin D or a fish-oil supplement and a placebo.
sentences.chinese: 两组服用维生素D和鱼油补剂的一种和一片安慰剂。

sentences.english: The race is on to understand the precise mechanisms behind nocebo.
sentences.chinese: 理解反安慰剂效应背后的正确机理的竞赛已经开始。

sentences.english: Randomized controlled trials (RCTs) comparing any antibiotic versus placebo or no intervention were identified.
sentences.chinese: 收集比较抗生素与安慰剂或空白对照的随机对照试验。

sentences.english: Large, randomised, placebo-controlled trials are urgently needed.
sentences.chinese: 急需进行大样本安慰剂对照的随机试验。

sentences.english: There was no placebo for MBCT patients.
sentences.chinese: 参与MBCT的患者没有服用安慰剂。

sentences.english: There are limits to even the strongest placebo effect.
sentences.chinese: 甚至法力最强的安慰剂效应也是有极限的。

sentences.english: Savard said the placebo effect in this case, though, is very real.
sentences.chinese: 萨瓦尔德博士称母乳其实也起了安慰剂的效果。

definition: to take medicine orally/oral (contraceptive etc)/to say that one is convinced
subject (in an experiment)/participant (in a clinical trial etc)
to accompany/(of a doctor etc) to do a follow-up (on a patient, client etc)
Taxol (a.k.a. Paclitaxel), mitotic inhibitor used in cancer chemotherapy
Ibuprofen or Nurofen/also called 異丁苯丙酸|异丁苯丙酸
